item.title: Report E-2024080729
item.description:
Report E-2024080729

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0404 ET, Brian Ebl, with Dayton Freight, notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal St. Peters MO (stl 007). It was reported that 1 pint of “cardinal 63MGE Exterior Polyurethane catalyst” UN1263 was released from one damaged 1-gallon Metal pail due to Improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they feel comfortable with terminal personnel cleaning the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024080728
item.description:
Report E-2024080728

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PROTRANS INTERNATIONAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:55 EST on 7/31, Patrick Weale with Dayton Freight Lines contacted ERTS to report a spill of initially 1 gallon of Epoxy Resin impacting the dock and trailer floors. A 275gal poly tote of the product was punctured by a forklift, causing the spill. The terminal will clean the spill using terminal-issued PPE and absorbents. The remaining content will be drained from the tote into several 55al metal drums. The waste and debris will be collected into another 55gal metal drum.

item.title: Report X-2024081872
item.description:
Report X-2024081872

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 17:30 IN DOORWAY 24, OF THE UNLOAD SECTION C, OF THE UPS EARTH CITY, MO HUB. THE PACKAGE (A 10X8X10IN 40LBS EDGE CRUSH TEST FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND UPSIDE DOWN LEAKING WITH THE CARDBOARD SATURATED. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND ALL MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE UPS DMP PROCESSING AREA. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.
